t: 1:4*r Septuagint; Hebrew does not have this line.
1:5*r Sons*i may mean descendants*i or successors*i or nations*i ; also in verses 6-9, 17 and 23.
1:6*r Many Hebrew manuscripts and Vulgate (see also Septuagint and Gen. 10:3); most Hebrew manuscripts Diphath*i
1:10*r Father*i may mean ancestor*i or predecessor*i or founder*i ; also in verses 11, 13, 18 and 20.
1:13*r Or of*i the*i Sidonians,*i the*i foremost*i
1:17*r One Hebrew manuscript and some Septuagint manuscripts (see also Gen. 10:23); most Hebrew manuscripts do not have this line.
1:22*r Some Hebrew manuscripts and Syriac (see also Gen. 10:28); most Hebrew manuscripts Ebal*i
1:24*r Hebrew; some Septuagint manuscripts Arphaxad,*i Cainan*i (see also note at Gen. 11:10)
1:36*r Many Hebrew manuscripts, some Septuagint manuscripts and Syriac (see also Gen. 36:11); most Hebrew manuscripts Zephi*i
1:36*r Some Septuagint manuscripts (see also Gen. 36:12); Hebrew Gatam,*i Kenaz,*i Timna*i and*i Amalek*i
1:40*r Many Hebrew manuscripts and some Septuagint manuscripts (see also Gen. 36:23); most Hebrew manuscripts Alian*i
1:41*r Many Hebrew manuscripts and some Septuagint manuscripts (see also Gen. 36:26); most Hebrew manuscripts Hamran*i
1:42*r Many Hebrew and Septuagint manuscripts (see also Gen. 36:27); most Hebrew manuscripts Zaavan,*i Jaakan*i
1:42*r See Gen. 36:28; Hebrew Dishon,*i a variant of Dishan*i
1:50*r Many Hebrew manuscripts, some Septuagint manuscripts, Vulgate and Syriac (see also Gen. 36:39); most Hebrew manuscripts Pai*i
